content.text: is designed to export account-related data for reporting purposes, specifically formatted for Excel export. It retrieves account information based on parameters provided in XML format, processes the data, and outputs a structured result set. The procedure utilizes temporary tables, dynamic SQL, and a PIVOT operation to transform and aggregate data from multiple related tables in the database.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to several factors:
It involves multiple joins across different tables, including full joins and left joins.
It uses a PIVOT operation to transform rows into columns, which adds complexity to the data processing logic.
The procedure handles XML input, which requires parsing and interpreting the XML structure.
It includes conditional logic and dynamic SQL elements, which can be challenging to maintain and debug.

: This parameter is expected to contain XML data that specifies the criteria for searching accounts. The XML structure is not detailed in the procedure, but it is used to filter and retrieve relevant account data.
to prevent the sending of row count messages, and sets the transaction isolation level to
to allow dirty reads, which can improve performance but leads to reading uncommitted data.
is created to store intermediate results with a predefined schema.
The procedure calls another stored procedure,
, passing the XML parameter and other default values to populate the temporary table with account data. This shows that
is responsible for the initial data retrieval based on the XML criteria.

A subquery is used to select distinct attributes and their statuses from the temporary table and related tables. This involves complex joins and conditional logic to determine the correct attribute descriptions.
A PIVOT operation is applied to transform attribute types into columns, aggregating data using the
The transformed data is selected and grouped by key account fields, producing a result set that includes account numbers, facility information, utility details, and various attribute statuses.
: While this can improve performance by reducing locking overhead, it risks reading uncommitted or inconsistent data.
: The use of a temporary table can impact performance, especially if the dataset is large. Indexing the temporary table improve performance but is not implemented here.
: The full joins and PIVOT operation can be resource-intensive, leading to slow performance on large datasets.
: The absence of indexes on the temporary table and the joined tables can lead to inefficient query execution plans.
can lead to data consistency issues, as it allows reading data that might not be committed.
: The complexity of the joins and the PIVOT operation may not scale well with large datasets, leading to performance degradation.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and failures during execution.
: The procedure assumes that the XML input is correctly formatted and does not include validation or error handling for malformed XML.
: The complexity and interdependencies with other stored procedures and tables make maintenance challenging, especially if changes are required in the business logic or data structure.

CREATE PROCEDURE [Billing].[usp_SearchAccountsBy_Excel_Export]
(
	@ParametersXML XML
)
AS
BEGIN
	SET NOCOUNT ON;
	SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ UNCOMMITTED;
	SET FMTONLY OFF;

	CREATE TABLE #TempSearchResults
		(UniqueAccountSeqid int,
		AccountSeqId int,
		CurrentAccountNumber VARCHAR(15),
		UtilityServiceAccountName VARCHAR(100),
		UtilityServiceAddress VARCHAR(100),
		AccountStatus  VARCHAR(2),
		AccountPreviousStatus  VARCHAR(2),
		AccountStatusCodePeriod  VARCHAR(6),
		IsTimeOfDayAccount  VARCHAR(1),
		BillingCycle  VARCHAR(15),
		AccountEffectiveTurnOn DATETIME,
		AccountEffectiveTurnOff DATETIME, 
		UtilityCompany  VARCHAR(100),
		InvoiceBillingGroup  VARCHAR(100),
		AgencyCodeOEC  VARCHAR(6),
		AgencyName  VARCHAR(100),
		OecFacilityNumber  VARCHAR(7),
		FacilityName  VARCHAR(100),
		FacilityAddress  VARCHAR(100),
		BBL  VARCHAR(15),
		EnergyDeliveryType  VARCHAR(3),
		DeliveryTariffRate  VARCHAR(10),
		BudgetGroupDEMName  VARCHAR(100),
		RateGroup1 VARCHAR(10),
		RateGroup2 VARCHAR(10),
		RateGroup3 VARCHAR(10),
		RateGroup4 VARCHAR(10),
		RateGroup5 VARCHAR(10),
		EnergyUnit VARCHAR(10),
		DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate DATETIME, 
		--RowNumber INT ,
		--[RowCount] INT,
		isActive BIT);


	DECLARE @Total INT 
	INSERT INTO #TempSearchResults
	--EXEC [Billing].[usp_SearchAccountsBy] @ParametersXML
	
	EXEC [Billing].[usp_SearchAccountsBy_Updated] @ParametersXML = NULL, @SearchText = '', @CurrentPageNumber = 0, @PageSize = 0, @SortColumn = '', @SortOrder = '', @ForReport = 'N', @Total = @Total OUTPUT

	SELECT  
		piv.CurrentAccountNumber AS AccountNumber
		,piv.FacilityName
		,piv.FacilityAddress
		,piv.UtilityServiceAddress
		,piv.OecFacilityNumber
		,piv.EnergyDeliveryType AS EnergyType
		,piv.UtilityCompany
		,piv.DeliveryTariffRate AS TariffCode
		,piv.BudgetGroupDEMName AS TariffDescription
		,piv.AgencyName
		,piv.AgencyCodeOEC
		,CAST(MAX (piv.IntervalMeter) AS VARCHAR) AS IntervalMeter
		,CAST(MAX( piv.DemarcationBox ) AS VARCHAR) DemarcationBox
		,CAST(MAX(piv.DistributedGenerationType) AS VARCHAR) AS DistributedGenerationType
		,CAST(MAX(piv.DemandResponse) AS VARCHAR) AS DemandResponse
		,CAST(MAX(piv.[High Pressure Gas]) AS VARCHAR) AS HighPressureGas
		,CAST(MAX(piv.[Real-TimeMetering]) AS VARCHAR) AS [Real-TimeMetering]
		,CAST(MAX(CASE WHEN piv.[Real-TimeMetering] IS NOT NULL THEN AttributeUpdatedOn END) AS INT) AS [Real-TimeMeteringStatusAsOf]
		,CAST(MAX( piv.NetMetered	) AS VARCHAR) NetMetered
		,CAST(MAX(CONVERT(INT,piv.IsActive)) AS BIT) AS IsActive
		,CAST(MAX (piv.AMI) AS VARCHAR) AS AMI
	FROM
		(SELECT DISTINCT
			CASE WHEN PA.AssociatedTypeId IS NULL THEN PA.Description END AS attributeType,
			CASE WHEN PA.AssociatedTypeId IS NOT NULL THEN PA.Description END AS attributeStatus,
			CASE 
				WHEN AP.AttributeTypeOptionSeqid IS NOT NULL 
				THEN 
				STUFF((SELECT DISTINCT ',' + ato1.ShortDescription FROM #TempSearchResults va1
				FULL JOIN Billing.AccountProgramAttributeType apat1 ON va1.UniqueAccountSeqid = apat1.AccountUniqueSeqID 
				INNER JOIN Billing.AttributeTypeOption AS ato1 ON ato1.AttributeTypeOptionSeqid = apat1.AttributeStatusOptionSeqid	OR ato1.AttributeTypeOptionSeqid = apat1.AttributeTypeOptionSeqid 
				INNER JOIN Billing.ProgramAttributeType AS pat1 ON pat1.ProgramAttributeTypeSeqID = ato1.AttributeTypeSeqid
				WHERE va1.UniqueAccountSeqid IS NOT NULL
				AND va.AccountSeqId= va1.AccountSeqId AND ato1.AttributeTypeSeqid = AT.AttributeTypeSeqid 
				FOR XML PATH(''), TYPE ).value('.', 'NVARCHAR(MAX)'),1,1,'') 
				WHEN AP.AttributeTypeOptionSeqid IS NULL THEN AST.ShortDescription
			END AS TypeShortDescription,
			CASE WHEN AT.AttributeTypeSeqid  IS NOT NULL 
			THEN (SELECT atto.ShortDescription FROM Billing.AttributeTypeOption AS atto WHERE atto.AttributeTypeOptionSeqid = AP.AttributeStatusOptionSeqid) 
			ELSE NULL END AS StatusShortDescription
			,va.UniqueAccountSeqid
			,va.AccountSeqId
			,va.CurrentAccountNumber
			,va.UtilityServiceAccountName
			,va.UtilityServiceAddress
			,va.AccountStatus
			,va.AccountPreviousStatus
			,va.AccountStatusCodePeriod
			,va.IsTimeOfDayAccount
			,va.BillingCycle
			,va.AccountEffectiveTurnOn
			,va.AccountEffectiveTurnOff
			,va.UtilityCompany
			,va.InvoiceBillingGroup
			,va.AgencyCodeOEC
			,va.AgencyName
			,va.OecFacilityNumber
			,va.FacilityName
			,va.FacilityAddress
			,va.BBL
			,va.EnergyDeliveryType
			,va.DeliveryTariffRate
			,va.BudgetGroupDEMName
			,va.RateGroup1
			,va.RateGroup2
			,va.RateGroup3
			,va.RateGroup4
			,va.RateGroup5
			,va.EnergyUnit
			,va.DeliveryTariffEffectiveDate
			--,va.RowNumber
			--,va.[RowCount]
			,va.isActive
			, AP.AttributeUpdatedOn
			FROM #TempSearchResults va
			FULL JOIN [Billing].[AccountProgramAttributeType] AP ON AP.AccountUniqueSeqID = va.UniqueAccountSeqid
			FULL JOIN [Billing].[ProgramAttributeType] PA ON AP.[ProgramAttributeTypeSeqid] = PA.[ProgramAttributeTypeSeqID] OR AP.[AttributeStatusSeqid] = PA.[ProgramAttributeTypeSeqID]
			LEFT JOIN [Billing].[AttributeTypeOption] AT ON AP.[AttributeTypeOptionSeqid] = AT.[AttributeTypeOptionSeqid] 
			FULL JOIN [Membership].[EC3Membership] M ON AP.[AuthenticatedUserID] = m.[AuthenticatedUserID]
			LEFT JOIN [Billing].[AttributeTypeOption] AST ON AP.AttributeStatusOptionSeqId = AST.[AttributeTypeOptionSeqid]
			WHERE va.UniqueAccountSeqid IS NOT NULL
		) src
		PIVOT
		(
		   MIN(typeShortDescription)  
		  FOR attributeType IN ([DemandResponse], [DemarcationBox], [DistributedGenerationType],[IntervalMeter],[Real-TimeMetering],[ElectricVehicleChargingStation],[NetMetered],[High Pressure Gas],[AMI] )
		) piv
	GROUP BY
		piv.CurrentAccountNumber  
		,piv.FacilityName
		,piv.FacilityAddress
		,piv.UtilityServiceAddress
		,piv.OecFacilityNumber
		,piv.EnergyDeliveryType
		,piv.UtilityCompany
		,piv.DeliveryTariffRate 
		,piv.BudgetGroupDEMName 
		,piv.AgencyName
		,piv.AgencyCodeOEC
END;
